    • Constructor Detail

      • ContextAnalyser

        public ContextAnalyser(java.lang.String dataBaseHostName,
                       java.lang.String dbName,
                       java.lang.String dataBasePortNumber,
                       java.lang.String dataBaseLogin,
                       java.lang.String dataBasePassword,
                       java.util.ArrayList<ForeignKey> fks)
        Parameters:
        dataBaseHostName - the DataBase host name where we will make the transformation.
        dbName - the data base name where we will make the transformation.
        dataBasePortNumber - the port of data base where we will make the transformation.
        dataBaseLogin - the login of the data base where we will make the transformation.
        dataBasePassword - the password of the login of the data base where we will make the transformation.
        fks - A list of foreign keys that we want to generate the transformation.

    • Method Detail

      • getDicoTable

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> getDicoTable()

      • analyse

        public Transformation analyse(ForeignKey fk)
                       throws LoadUnexistentTableException
        Create a Transformation Object that was configured to make able the adding of foreign key if it is possible.
        Parameters:
        fk - foreign key that we want to add to the DB with the returned transformation
        Returns:
        - If the fk is already on the DB, return an EmptyTransformation. - If it is possible, return a DBTransformation Object that was configured to make able the adding of key foreign - Finally, if the algorithm don't find a possible transformation it return a ImpossibleTransformation
        Throws:
        LoadUnexistentTableException - if the tables and/or the columns from the fk parameter don't exist on the DB
        See Also:
        Transformation, DBTransformation, EmptyTransformation, ImpossibleTransformation

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<Transformation>

      • next

        public Transformation next()
        Return the next Transformation Object of the iteration that was configured to make able the adding of foreign key if it is possible.
        Specified by:
        next in interface java.util.Iterator<Transformation>
        Returns:
        - If the fk is already on the DB, return an EmptyTransformation. - If it is possible, return a DBTransformation Object that was configured to make able the adding of key foreign - Finally, if the algorithm don't find a possible transformation it return a ImpossibleTransformation
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the tables and/or the columns from the fk parameter don't exist on the DB
        See Also:
        Transformation, DBTransformation, EmptyTransformation, ImpossibleTransformation
